solution_line_template: Elle and Andrea will spend ${soda_cost_per_can} x {num_soda_cans} = $<<{soda_cost_per_can}*{num_soda_cans}={soda_total_cost}>>{soda_total_cost} for the soda.
Elle and Andrea will spend ${soda_total_cost} + ${chicken_wings_cost} = $<<{soda_total_cost}+{chicken_wings_cost}={elle_andrea_total_spend}>>{elle_andrea_total_spend} for the soda and chicken wings.
Elle, Andrea, and Joe together will spend ${elle_andrea_total_spend} + ${cake_cost} = $<<{elle_andrea_total_spend}+{cake_cost}={rest_of_firm_total_spend}>>{rest_of_firm_total_spend}.

So, Mary will spend ${mary_total_spend} - ${rest_of_firm_total_spend} = $<<{mary_total_spend}-{rest_of_firm_total_spend}={mary_spend_difference}>>{mary_spend_difference} more than all of them combined.
